subject: Real Estate
title: Anchoring Bias and Property Prices
description: A quick win: understand Anchoring Bias and Property Prices.

hook.text: A seller lists a home for $800,000. The buyer offers $720,000, feeling clever. Both are anchored to $800K.

buildup.text: Anchoring bias means the first number you see becomes your mental reference point, even if it's arbitrary.

discovery.text: Experiments show that even random numbers influence how much people are willing to pay for real estate.

twist.text: In falling markets, sellers anchor to their purchase price and refuse to sell below it â€” even at a loss.

climax.text: Anchoring keeps prices sticky on the way down. Sellers would rather wait years than accept a lower anchor.

punchline.text: The asking price shapes your offer â€” even when it's wrong.

quiz.question: How does anchoring bias affect sellers in falling markets?
options: They refuse to sell below their purchase price
